intro: Ponera modesta, commonly known as the small antplant, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, compact growth habit and clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, round berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Ponera modesta thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in forest understories.
